title: [Large-scale] Instructional Design Based on Variation Theory to Enhance Information Text Genre Awareness and Learning Effectiveness

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and experience in analyzing informational texts
context.additional_context: A professional development course for in-service practitioners to improve math pedagogy, focusing on real-time collaboration and feedback systems using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can identify structural features of informational texts (e.g., introduction-body-conclusion) with 80% accuracy.
Learners can generate mathematical concept explanation texts by applying the variation theory pattern (contrast-contrast-generalization).
Learners improve the genre appropriateness of informational texts by over 75% through peer-reviewed PBL tasks.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
